intro: Randia stanleyana, commonly known as Stanley's randia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Randia stanleyana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
